26$Condition: Depression$5/18/2017 6:20:41 PM$Reviewer: Lucky Larry, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$4$I have been taking desipramine (the generic from Actavis) for depression since 2003, returning to it after trying other meds.  It is the only one that helped, although high doses caused shortness of breath, low-back pain, nightmares, stress, and anxiety.  The key has been finding the correct dose.  An important discovery was that chocolate produces a synergistic effect.  Taking it in the evening right after a large serving of dark chocolate and 10 ounces of milk allows me to keep the dose and prescription costs low.  It is not nearly as effective without chocolate during the day.  But a problem is that it is addictive.  Increasing the dose made me more depressed but going down improved my mood, so finding the optimal one has been difficult.

It's negatively effecting those around me as much as it is me.  I have to find another med that helps my nerve pain as well as this does b/c the depression is just unbearable.

column7: so I was also concerned about bad breath. Dr. said I wasn't close to effective dose
column8: so I backed down to 25mg and he added mood stabilizer - Lamictal
column9: which is another story. In my case
column10: I seem to be especially prone to side effects of many medications at very low doses
column11: so I think that is one reason Desipramine did not work well for me. Oh
column12: and it was very constipating and I have gallbladder disease
column13: which also has that affect - so couldn't tolerate both together. Don't have money for gallbladder surgery
column14: so had two reasons for really cutting down on Desipramine. Have tried everything else on market for depression over 20 years
column15: so the fact that 25mg helps to a degree is why I haven't changed.
